intro: Clavija cardenasii, commonly known as the Cárdenas's clavija, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
